results.title: Starting to read: ducks
results.brief_description: Shows a variety of ducks on a farm to introduce such words and concepts as big, small, walk, feet, water and eat. Superimposes the words on the picture and uses a song to intorduce the words being studied. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels

results.title: Starting Tapestry (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: MSI Productions, Pat Marshall and Maggie Clarke
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Joy for Life”.
There is a wonderfully rich variety of tapestry styles throughout the world and the techniques are easy to learn at any age. “Starting tapestry” will show you the materials you need, how to work some basic stitches and some attractive items which are easy to make. Hannah Gordon introduces the many possibilities tapestry offers to everyone, young and old.

results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Joy for Life”.
There is a wonderfully rich variety of tapestry styles throughout the world, and the techniques are easy to learn. This video and its accompanying booklet will show you how to begin, the materials you need, how to work some basic stitches and some attractive items which are easy to make. Introduced by Hannah Gordon.

results.title: Starting out: an introduction to public speaking

Episode of Series “Speaking with confidence”.
‘Starting out’ covers personal appearance and dress, eye contact, gesture, pause and movement in delivering an effective speech.

results.title: Starting from scratch
results.brief_description: An instructional video providing informative and simple advice on gardening techniques for the beginner or even the experienced gardener. Presented by Peter Seabrook, a garden specialist who writes and broadcasts both in the UK and the USA, and Anne Swithinbank, a writer and broadcaster for the BBC with regular appearances on Gardeners’ World, the video is divided into two programs titled “A New garden” and “Renovating a derelict garden”. Each program is dealt with in detailed sections with close-up photography and demonstrations of the techniques used. Also includes a booklet of notes and guidelines.

Each program is dealt with in detailed sections with close-up photography and demonstrations of the techniques used. Also includes a booklet of notes and guidelines.

results.title: Starting from scratch
results.creator_credit: Nihon Hoso Kyokai, UNICEF, Alastair Matheson and Horst Cerni
results.brief_description: The determined people of Tanzania in East Africa are “starting from scratch” to build up their country’s health, education and welfare services. We meet two women, typical of the many helping to build Tanzania’s future: Aurelia, a teacher trained with UNICEF assistance, and Mageta, a dietician travelling from village to village.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Nihon Hoso Kyokai, UNICEF, Alastair Matheson and Horst Cerni
